item.title: Energy bills to rise by at least £139 for millions of households
item.description: Fuel poverty charities say the price cap increase will come at the worst time during winter.

item.title: COP26: Government defends Alok Sharma over quarantine-free travel
item.description: Alok Sharma reportedly visited more than 30 countries as president of a climate change conference.

item.title: Covid-19: Safety net for live events and Wales lifts most restrictions
item.description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus pandemic this Friday morning.

item.title: China: Backlash over marriage question in Olympian's interview
item.description: Chinese athlete Gong Lijiao was asked about her marriage plans and described as a "manly woman".

item.title: Apple to scan iPhones for child sex abuse images
item.description: Apple announces it will implement a system to scan US iPhones for images of child sexual abuse.

item.title: Belarus: IOC expels two coaches over Krystina Timanovskaya case
item.description: Ms Timanovskaya said she was forced to leave Tokyo after she complained about her coaches online.

item.title: Covid: Most of Wales' coronavirus rules to end Saturday
item.description: Nightclubs will be able to reopen, but face masks will still be needed in shops and hospitals.

item.title: A-levels: Bumper year for top grades predicted
item.description: Results could see very high grades this year, which could put pressure on some university courses.

item.title: Starter salaries rising amid candidate shortages
item.description: KPMG research shows now is a good time to be looking for a job, due to high demand from employers.

item.title: Australia borders: Citizens living overseas could be 'trapped' if they return
item.description: Australians who live overseas will require exemptions to leave Australia if they return home.

item.title: Covid: Women in hotel quarantine to get harassment reporting line
item.description: The government takes a new step to prevent sexual harassment by security guards in quarantine hotels.

item.title: The Papers: Social media push on jabs, and uni entrance exams
item.description: New campaigns to encourage the take up of Covid vaccinations are a focus for the front pages.

item.title: Fish with 'human' teeth caught in North Carolina
item.description: The creature, caught in North Carolina, is believed to be a sheepshead fish.

item.title: South Park creators sign $900m deal to make seasons and movies
item.description: The agreement comes as technology and media giants battle to dominate the global streaming market.

item.title: Sharks from above: Filming 'friendly' encounters in Sydney
item.description: Jason Iggleden captures stunning moments in Sydney, often helping to reduce people's fear.

item.title: Afghanistan: British soldier's mother tells of grief, years after his death
item.description: Nathalie Bouzigues' son, Corporal Jake Hartley, was killed while serving in Helmand in 2012.

item.title: Will Turkey's bees return after the wildfires?
item.description: Residents of Marmaris, Turkey, are mourning their bees and honey, lost to fires.

item.title: Strictly Come Dancing: CBBC's Rhys Stephenson joins 2021 line-up
item.description: The actor and children’s TV presenter says he is "buzzing" to join John Whaite, AJ Odudu and others.

item.title: Scotland's colourful marine life
item.description: Scuba-diver Ross McLaren has taken thousands of photos of marine life in Scotland's rivers and sea-lochs.

item.title: Energy price cap: What is it and how does it affect my bills?
item.description: The regulator Ofgem announces that the energy price cap will rise - but how does it work?

item.title: China: How Delta threatens a prized zero Covid strategy
item.description: China's battling its widest outbreak since Wuhan - how long can it keep Covid out?

item.title: Afghan war: I can still hear my cry, says mother of dead soldier
item.description: As fighting in Afghanistan rages, the BBC speaks to the mother of a British soldier who died there nearly 10 years ago.

item.title: Riots 10 years on: The five summer nights when London burned
item.description: In August 2011 a man was shot dead by police in London, triggering the worst civil unrest in decades.

item.title: Zola: How a road trip became a viral story of sex trafficking
item.description: The epic Twitter saga of a 19-year-old that attracted thousands of followers hits the big screen.

item.title: Covid vaccine and needle phobia: 'It feels like the world is ending'
item.description: Adam, 23, says he's so scared of needles he's been unable to get a Covid-19 jab.

item.title: 'Only way you'll get to Oxford is on a bus'
item.description: Social mobility campaigner Sir Peter Lampl worries about the lack of fair opportunity for young people.

item.title: 'It just isn't sustainable' - Why touring in the EU is problematic for UK bands
item.description: One band explain what it's been like trying to tour in France in the age of Covid and Brexit.

item.title: COP26: What is the UN climate conference in Glasgow and why is it so important?
item.description: The annual climate change summit is being held in Glasgow - who's going and what's at stake?

item.title: Ben Elliot: Conservative Party money man with A-list connections
item.description: Tory fundraiser and co-chairman Ben Elliot is at the centre of controversy over an elite donors club.

item.title: COP26: How serious is the government about climate conference?
item.description: With less than 90 days to go to Glasgow climate summit, there is uncertainty surrounding the event.

item.title: 'If he had stayed at Villa he would be immortal' - but where does Grealish fit in at Man City?
item.description: BBC Sport takes a closer look at what Jack Grealish will bring to Manchester City after signing from Aston Villa for £100m.

item.title: GB boxer Price to fight for Olympic middleweight gold after narrow points win
item.description: Great Britain boxer Lauren Price will fight for a gold medal on the final day of Tokyo 2020 after winning her women's middleweight semi-final.

item.title: Great Britain win hockey bronze with thrilling victory against India
item.description: Great Britain claim bronze in the women's hockey at Tokyo 2020 with a thrilling 4-3 victory against India.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: GB's Lauren Price stages 'terrific' comeback to book place in middleweight final
item.description: Watch highlights as GB's Lauren Price secures her place in the gold-medal middleweight bout at Tokyo 2020 after staging a "terrific" comeback to beat Nouchka Fontijn.

item.title: England v India highlights: James Anderson leads England fightback on day two
item.description: James Anderson takes two wickets in two balls to lead an England fightback on day two of the First Test with India at Trent Bridge, leaving the tourists 125-4 at the close of play.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Cuba's Julio La Cruz wins gold in the men's heavyweight boxing
item.description: Cuba's Julio La Cruz wins gold in the men's heavyweight boxing with victory over Russia's Muslim Gadzhimagomedov.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Boxer Lauren Price in gold medal bout, women's hockey team win bronze
item.description: Boxer Lauren Price secures her place in the gold-medal middleweight bout at Tokyo 2020 after Great Britain win an Olympic medal in the women's hockey.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics medal table - which country has won most golds?
item.description: Which country is leading the medal table? How are Great Britain getting on? Medals table for the 2020 Olympics in Tokyo.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Great Britain win bronze in thriller against India
item.description: Watch highlights as Great Britain's women win hockey bronze by beating India 4-3 in a dramatic match at the Oi Hockey Stadium in Tokyo.

item.title: Indian women's hockey: Sixteen stories of struggle, one tale of triumph
item.description: Fighting until the very end, India go down 3-4 to Great Britain in the bronze medal playoff.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: The 'buzz' of winning a bronze medal
item.description: Many athletes go into the Olympic games wanting gold, but for some, making the podium is enough.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Team GB's Matt Walls wins omnium gold
item.description: Team GB cyclist Matt Walls is crowned Olympic champion on his debut with a dominant performance in the men's omnium.

item.title: Alex Yee: 'I didn't feel worthy to stand on the start line'
item.description: Alex Yee, 23, won two medals at the Olympics - but had self-worth issues when he first turned pro.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Galal Yafai beats Saken Bibossinov to reach flyweight final
item.description: Great Britain's Galal Yafai reaches the Olympic flyweight final with a thrilling win over Saken Bibossinov of Kazakhstan.

item.title: Peter Bol: The Sudanese-Australian runner who lifted a nation
item.description: Peter Bol's Olympics has delighted Australians, becoming a "symbol of what we can aspire to be".

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Liverpool millionaire aiding GB's medal haul
item.description: Barrie Wells sponsored Olympic silver medallist Keely Hodgkinson after she failed to get funding.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Britain's Liam Heath claims bronze in men's kayak single 200m
item.description: Great Britain's Liam Heath claims a bronze medal after a "hesitant start" to the defence of his Olympic men's kayak single 200m.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Keegan Palmer wins first men's park skateboarding gold
item.description: Australian 18-year-old Keegan Palmer wins gold in the first Olympic men's park skateboarding final at Tokyo 2020.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Day-by-day guide to the key events, big stars and British medal hopes
item.description: Want to know what's happening when in Tokyo? Check out our comprehensive guide to all the action in Japan.

item.title: What are the holiday rules for travel to green, amber and red list countries?
item.description: The government has updated its red, amber and green lists of countries.

item.title: Covid-19: Five ways to avoid catching the virus indoors
item.description: As social distancing restrictions end in England and ease in Scotland, good ventilation remains vital.

item.title: Covid rules: What has changed?
item.description: Major changes to lockdown rules have taken effect in England and Scotland, but some restrictions remain.

item.title: Covid: What do under-30s need to know about the vaccine?
item.description: The government is expected to announce that 16 and 17-year-olds will receive the Covid vaccine.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Long Covid: What is it and what are the symptoms?
item.description: New research links as many as 200 different symptoms to the condition.

item.title: Covid: When will teenagers get the jab and do I need a booster?
item.description: More teenagers will be able to receive the Covid vaccine, and a third jab will soon be available for the most vulnerable.

item.title: Covid: What are the social distancing rules in England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland?
item.description: Social distancing rules are changing across the UK.

item.title: ‘Covid passports’: How to get the NHS Covid Pass
item.description: People in England can use the pass for travel and to visit venues which ask for them.

item.title: Coronavirus: How does the NHS test-and-trace system and app work?
item.description: The number of people pinged by the Covid app has fallen significantly.

item.title: Covid: Which children are being vaccinated and why?
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of children at higher risk from coronavirus infection will be offered a Covid vaccine in the UK.

item.title: What are the Delta, Gamma, Beta and Alpha Covid variants?
item.description: UK coronavirus cases are rising due to a variant first identified in India that spreads more easily.

item.title: Lockdown muscle loss: Five ways to get back in shape
item.description: Lockdown inactivity may have left people with weaker muscles - there are simple solutions.
